newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian shares sluggish, most stocks ease.
newsitem.headline: Estonian shares sluggish, most stocks ease.

text.p: A sluggish Estonian stock market was dominated on Tuesday by two big blocks of Hansapank shares as many prices eased, dealers said.
"Except for the two 95,000 share blocks of Hansapank stocks nothing really happened", said one dealer.
The Tallinn stock exchange index fell 1.37 percent to close at 186.18 on turnover of 58 million kroons.
Hansapank dominated trade on 44.2 million kroons of shares changing hands to close three kroons down at 75.25.
Saving Bank was one of the few to firm during the day to close up one kroon at 87.35 kroons on 7.3 million kroons.
Forekspank eased by 0.45 kroons to close at 142 kroons after trade of only 2.5 million kroons and Union Bank strengthened to end up 0.10 kroons at 41.20 kroons on a low 1.1 million kroons.
Over-the-counter market volume fell away to record trade of 8.6 million kroons.
Rakvere meat plant accounted for most of the trade with four million kroons of stocks traded to end at 14.70 kroons, up 0.30 kroons.
Saku Brewery was up 0.48 kroons to finish at 52.08 kroons after turning over 2.3 million kroons of shares.
